WorkItem.Description:
When adding a MouseDoubleClick event to the DataGrid, the scrollbar triggers the MouseDoubleClick if you click twice on it fast (as you would do on a row/cell..
Â 
Doubleclicking the scrollbar should not trigger the MouseDoubleClick on the DataGrid.

Comments.Message:
Hello dozer,

I would say that this is by design. This is the very nature of routed events. Scrollbar doesn't handle the DoubleClick hence gets bubbled to DataGrid. Technically we could handle the event on Scrollbar and do nothing, but then that would stop the users from doing the opposite of your scenario. You should probably have a handler on  Scrollbar and do nothing, or in the handler of DataGrid you can choose to ignore if the event arised from within ScrollBar.

Ok... I'll take a look at this then. BTW (I know it's a bad idea to have here in the issue tracker :) ) but how do I hittest the scrollbar? 

Thanks.
